name: Lander, Parkin, and Selfridge conjecture
rephrased: If two different sets of k-th powers have the same sum, then the total number of terms in these two sets combined must be at least k.
implication_form: If the sum of some k-th powers equals the sum of other k-th powers, then the total number of terms in both sets must be at least k.
explained: The Lander, Parkin, and Selfridge conjecture states that if the sum of m terms, each a k-th power, equals the sum of n terms, each a k-th power, then the total number of terms (m + n) must be at least k.
